data.name: Sample - Qualys Web Application Scanning(WAS) - 2.0.0
data.description: Qualys Web Application Scanning (WAS) is a robust cloud-based application security product that continuously discovers, detects, and catalogs web applications and APIs.

workflows.description: Returns the total number of scans in the user’s account. Input parameters are optional and are used to filter the number of scans included in the count. Permissions required - User must have WAS module enabled. User account must have these permissions: Access Permission API Access. The count includes scans in the user's scope.
workflows.name: Get Scan Count

arguments.title: Qualys Web Application Scanning(WAS): Get Scan Count

workflows.description: Returns a list of scans on web applications which are in the user’s scope. Input parameters are optional and act as filters. Permissions required - User must have WAS module enabled. User account must have these permissions: Access Permission API Access. The output includes scans in the user's scope.
workflows.name: Search Scans

arguments.title: Qualys Web Application Scanning(WAS): Search Scans

workflows.description: Retrieves details for a scan on a web application which is in the user’s scope. Permissions required - User must have WAS module enabled. User account must have these permissions: Access Permission “API Access”. The output includes authentication records in the user's scope.
workflows.name: Get Scan Details

arguments.title: Qualys Web Application Scanning(WAS): Get Scan Details

workflows.description: Launches web application scanning. You can scan any number of web applications as a Multi-Scan through API. Permissions required - User must have WAS module enabled. User account must have these permissions: Access Permission “API Access” and “Launch WAS Scan“. The output includes scan targets in the user's scope.
workflows.name: Launch Scans

arguments.title: Qualys Web Application Scanning(WAS): Launch Scans

workflows.description: Retrieve the status of a scan on a web application which is in the user’s scope.
workflows.name: Get Scan Status

arguments.title: Qualys Web Application Scanning(WAS): Get Scan Status

workflows.description: Retrieve the results of a scan on a web application which is in the user’s scope. Permissions required - User must have WAS module enabled. User account must have these permissions: Access Permission “API Access”. The output includes scan targets in the user's scope.
workflows.name: Get Scan Results

arguments.title: Qualys Web Application Scanning(WAS): Get Scan Results

workflows.description: Delete an existing scan on a web application which is in the user’s scope. You can delete any scan in your account that is not running. Permissions required - User must have WAS module enabled. User account must have these permissions: Access Permission “API Access” and ”Delete WAS scan” permission. The scan to be deleted must be within the user’s scope.
workflows.name: Delete Scan

arguments.title: Qualys Web Application Scanning(WAS): Delete Scan

workflows.description: Returns the total number of web applications in the user’s account. Input parameters are optional and are used to filter the number of web applications included in the count. Permissions required - User must have WAS module enabled. User account must have these permissions: Access Permission “API Access”. The count includes web applications in the user's scope.
workflows.name: Get Web Applications Count

arguments.title: Qualys Web Application Scanning(WAS): Get Web Applications Count

workflows.description: Returns a list of web applications which are in the user’s scope. Permissions required - User must have WAS module enabled. User account must have these permissions: Access Permission “API Access”. The output includes web applications in the user's scope.
workflows.name: Search Web Applications

arguments.title: Qualys Web Application Scanning(WAS): Search Web Applications

workflows.description: Returns details for a web application which is in the user’s scope. The web application screenshot, when available, is included in the output in the “screenshot” element as a base64 encoded binary string. This string needs to be converted before a user can decode and view the image file (.jpg). Permissions required - User must have WAS module enabled. User account must have these permissions: Access Permission “API Access”. The output includes web applications in the user's scope.
workflows.name: Get Web Application Details

arguments.title: Qualys Web Application Scanning(WAS): Get Web Application Details

workflows.description:
Creates a new web application. Permissions required - User must have WAS module enabled. User account must have these permissions: Access Permission “API Access” and WAS Asset Permission “Create Web Asset”. The output includes web applications in the user's scope. If you want to add postman collection files, you must have the 'ENABLE_POSTMAN_COLLECTION' option enabled for your account. If this option is not enabled, contact Qualys Support to enable this option. When only “name” and “url” are specified:
- Scope defaults to ALL. The scanner will crawl all directories and subdirectories of the starting URL.
- No default option profile is specified. An option profile must be specified for each scan.
- No authentication records are defined. No form or server authentication will be performed.
- No blacklists or whitelists are defined. All directories and sub-directories of the starting URL will be scanned.
workflows.name: Create Web Application

arguments.title: Qualys Web Application Scanning(WAS): Create Web Application

workflows.description: Delete a web application configuration in your account. Permissions required - User must have WAS module enabled. User account must have these permissions: Access Permission “API Access” and WAS Asset Permission “Delete Web Asset”. The web application to be deleted must be within the user’s scope.
workflows.name: Delete Web Applications

arguments.title: Qualys Web Application Scanning(WAS): Delete Web Applications

workflows.description: Returns a list of reports which are in the user’s scope. Permissions required - User must have WAS module enabled. User account must have these permissions: Access Permission “API Access”. The output includes reports in the user's scope.
workflows.name: Search Reports

arguments.title: Qualys Web Application Scanning(WAS): Search Reports

workflows.description: Download a report which is in the user’s scope. Permissions required - User must have WAS module enabled. User account must have these permissions: Access Permission “API Access”. The output includes reports in the user's scope.
workflows.name: Download Report

arguments.title: Qualys Web Application Scanning(WAS): Download Report

workflows.description: Returns a list of option profiles which are in the user’s scope. Action logs are not included in the output. Permissions required - User must have WAS module enabled. User account must have these permissions: Access Permission “API Access”. The Output includes option profiles in the user's scope. Input parameters are optional and act as filters.
workflows.name: Search Option Profiles

arguments.title: Qualys Web Application Scanning(WAS): Search Option Profiles

workflows.description: Returns a list of scheduled scans on web applications which are in the user’s scope. Permissions required - User must have WAS module enabled. User account must have these permissions: Access Permission “API Access”. The output includes scan targets in the user's scope. Input parameters are optional and act as filters.
workflows.name: Search Schedule

arguments.title: Qualys Web Application Scanning(WAS): Search Schedule

workflows.description: Retrieves details for a scheduled scan on a web application which is in the user’s scope. Permissions required - User must have WAS module enabled. User account must have these permissions: Access Permission “API Access”. The output includes schedules in the user's scope.
workflows.name: Get Schedule Details

arguments.title: Qualys Web Application Scanning(WAS): Get Schedule Details

workflows.description: Returns a list of tags based on the input parameters specified. Permissions required - Managers with full scope, other users must have Access Permission “API Access”
workflows.name: Search Tags

arguments.title: Qualys Web Application Scanning(WAS): Search Tags

workflows.description: Creates a new tag and possibly child tags. Permissions required - Managers with full scope, other users must have these permissions: Access Permission “API Access”, Tag Permission “Create User Tag”, Tag Permission “Modify Dynamic Tag Rules” (to create a dynamic tag) Note: Provider name is mandatory in case of Cloud Asset tag.
workflows.name: Create Tag

arguments.title: Qualys Web Application Scanning(WAS): Create Tag

workflows.description: Updates an existing tag based on tag ID specified. Permissions required - Managers with full scope, other users must have these permissions: Access Permission “API Access”, Tag Permission “Create User Tag”, Tag Permission “Modify Dynamic Tag Rules” (to create a dynamic tag)
workflows.name: Update Tag

arguments.title: Qualys Web Application Scanning(WAS): Update Tag

workflows.description: Deletes a tag. Permissions required - Managers with full scope, other users must have these permissions: Access Permission “API Access” and Tag Permission “Delete User Tag”
workflows.name: Delete Tag

arguments.title: Qualys Web Application Scanning(WAS): Delete Tag

workflows.description: Returns a list of users based on input parameters specified. Input parameters are optional and act as filters, if no input parameter is specified, all users in the user’s scope are listed. Permissions required - Managers with full scope, other users must have Access Permission “API Access”.
workflows.name: Search Users

arguments.title: Qualys Web Application Scanning(WAS): Search Users
